This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The truth is, many other countries are over more troubles than we could ever fathom. Are those people not made by someone to live with life as they love it? If this movie makes you literally want to cry

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There didn't need to be too much that was different about this other than the ballroom dancing during busy party moments. However, Christine Love is very clumsy in dance and should get better. And I really wanted to see cuter outfits, like the 1930's dresses would be neat

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was originally a novel that was initially republished as a play to be performed on stage by a couple of actors. Unfortunately, it wasn't well received so Bertrand Blier decided to make the adaption himself. The movie was written and directed by Bertrand Blier
